result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerry K. Mosher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any or all other sentences

miscConds.notes:
AODA and follow through
Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent
DNA sample if not already provided

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA
Maintain full time employment/ 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Cooperate with Social Service with Chips order.
Counseling deemed by agent.

judgments.dispoDesc: This sentence is due to probation being revoked.

records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: 03:04 PM Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kerry K. Mosher appeared by video means from Jackson Correctional. Court has reviewed Def's petition for sentence adjustment and State's response. Def makes statement regarding other cases. Court advises only addressing this case today. Def presents arguments in support of petition. Response by the State. Remarks by the Court. Petition denied.

records.descr: Notice to D.A./D.A. response on pet. for sent. adj

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kerry K. Mosher
Current: N6500 Haipek Rd, Jackson Correctional Institution, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2019)
Prior: W14854 County Hwy C, Gleason, WI 54435

Court calls 14CF101, 17CF49, 17CM11 & 17CM72 @ 2:09 am. Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in court with attorney Alexander Paul Seifert.  Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties have received revocation summary packet and no corrections.  State gives plea agreement, Joint recommendation, Waive p.h. 17CF49, Information given to Atty and filed electronically 17CF49 plea to charge, 17CM72 DRI case, 17CM11 ct 1 plea, Ct 2 DRI.  14CF101 ct 1.  17CF49 3 years prison 1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision,  17CM11 Ct 1 2 years prison, 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision concurrent 17CF49 14CF101 ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement 3 year extended supervision consecutive 17CF49 & 17CM11 Conditions costs, DNA Surcharge and AODA and follow through,  Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  Cooperate with social service with Chips order,  Maintain full time employment/ 35 hours, Counseling deemed by agent.   324 day credit 14CF101.  Atty Seifert and def. agree to plea agreement.  17CF49 Waiver of preliminary examination filed.    Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Information filed electronically.  Atty Seifert has copy of information and waives reading.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties. 17CF49 Guilty plea, 17CM11 Ct 1 no contest plea.  Court will DRI 17CM72, 17CM11 Ct 2.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT rights.  Def. understand elements.  Def. admits prior convictions. Atty Seifert is satisfied.  Court finds plea is freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis. Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and find def. Guilty in 17CF49 Vehicle flee/elude officer, repeater, 17CM11 Ct 1 Battery, Domestic, repeater. State gives sentencing recommendation.  Credit 324, in 14CF101, 323 days in 17CM11 & 292 days in 17CF49. Victim rights complied. Atty Seifert gives sentencing statement.  17CF49 & 17CM11 324 days credit. 14CF101 357 days credit. Def. gives statement.  Def. questions two traffic citation.  Court advise def. civil judgment already taken.  Court orders 
14CF101 ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 year extended supervision, Conditions Costs to be paid during extended supervision,  AODA and  Maintain full time employment/ 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. ,  Maintain Absolute Sobriety,  Cooperate with social service with Chips order,  Counseling deemed by agent.  
17CF49 3 years prison, 1 year initial confinement, 2 years extended supervision, costs & 250 DNA Surcharge and sample. Consecutive to 14CF101.
17CM11 Ct 1 2 years prison, 1 year initial confinement, 1 year extended supervision concurrent 17CF49 & Consecutive to 14CF101, costs only $200 DNA Surcharge and sample
State heard on credit 14CF101 347 days credit. Atty Seifert replys.  Court orders credit 14CF101-357 days &  17CF49- 324 days & 17CM11 324 days.  Def. is eligible for Challenge and is eligible for Substance Program. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights.    Def. advised of postconviction rights.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in court, in custody with attorney Jessica L. Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 10:15 am.  State gives plea agreement, plea to ct 1,  withheld sentence 3 yrs probation consecutive to all other sentences, AODA & follow through & costs.  ct 2 Dismissed & read in.  Parties agree with plea agreement.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information Filed. Atty Schuster has copy of information.  Ct 1 Mnf/Dlvr Narcotics, 2nd, repeater, Def. admits prior convictions. Ct 1 Guilty plea, ct 2 Dismissed consistent to plea agreement. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Atty Schuster factual basis & is satisfied.  Court  finds plea is freely & voluntarily given, accepts plea & finds def. Guilty to Mnf/Dlvr Narcotic, 2nd, repeater in ct 1.  Ct 2 Dismissed. Def. has nothing to say.  Court accepts plea agreement & orders withheld sentence 3 yrs probation, consecutive to any orall other sentences, AODA & follow through, or whatever deemed by agent, costs & $250.00 DNA surcharge. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights.  DNA Sample if not already provided.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights.

Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in court with attorney Jessica L. Schuster.  Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, waive reading, reviewed.  Time limits for preliminary waived  Bond will remain  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Kerry K. Mosher in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Warrant vacated.  Def does not have copy of complaint.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an attorney.  State request cash bond.  Def is on probation hold.  Court sets bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
